OptionDisplayGroup.name: groupEtFuturum
OptionDisplayGroup.Description: Distribution options for Et Futurum Ores.

OptionChoice.name: enableEtFuturum
OptionChoice.Description: Should Custom Ore Generation handle Et Futurum ore generation?

Choice.description: Use Custom Ore Generation to handle Et Futurum ores.
Et Futurum ores will be handled by the mod itself.

OptionChoice.name: cleanUpEtFuturum
OptionChoice.Description: Should Custom Ore Generation use the Substitution Pass to remove all instances of Et Futurum ore from the world? If the mod's oregen can be turned off in its configuration, then it's recommended to do so, as the substitution pass can slow the game significantly. If this option is disabled without disabling the mod's own ore generation, you'll end up with two oregens working at once, flooding the world with ore. Enabled by default to ensure the ores are completely removed.

Choice.description: Use the substitution pass to clean up Et Futurum ores.
Et Futurum ores do not need to be cleaned up by a substitution pass.

Choice.Description: Wide, thin, and flat disks of ore.
Small, fairly rare motherlodes with 2-4 horizontal veins each.

Choice.description: Granite is not generated in the world.

OptionNumeric.name: etftGraniteFreq
OptionNumeric.Description: Frequency multiplier for Et Futurum Granite distributions

OptionNumeric.name: etftGraniteSize
OptionNumeric.Description: Size multiplier for Et Futurum Granite distributions

OptionChoice.name: etftMountainGraniteDist
OptionChoice.Description: Controls how Mountain Granite is generated

Choice.Description: Wide, thin, and flat disks of ore.
Small, fairly rare motherlodes with 2-4 horizontal veins each.

Choice.description: Mountain Granite is not generated in the world.

Substitute.name: etftOverworldBlockSubstitute0
Substitute.Comment: The global option deferredPopulationRange must be large enough to catch all ore clusters (>= 32).

Cloud.name: etftGraniteCloud
Cloud.Description: Wide, thin, and flat disks of ore. Primarily, this distribution is meant to provide realistic distribution of stone in a strata formation.

Veins.name: etftGraniteVeins
Veins.Description: Small, fairly rare motherlodes with 2-4 horizontal veins each.
